accessibilityStatementTitle: Accessibility statement for Appoint, update and remove a company director service
accessibilityStatementHeading: Accessibility statement for the Remove a company director service
accessibilityStatementReporting: Reporting accessibility problems with this service
accessibilityStatementTechnicalInformati: Technical information about this service’s accessibility
accessibilityStatementImproveAccessibili: What we’re doing to improve accessibility
accessibilityStatementAboutText: This accessibility statement applies to the Remove a company director service.
accessibilityStatementAboutPostLink: . We want as many people as possible to be able to use this service. For example, that means you should be able to:
accessibilityStatementAboutList1: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
accessibilityStatementAboutList2: zoom in up to 300% without the text disappearing off the screen
accessibilityStatementAboutList3: navigate most of the service using just a keyboard
accessibilityStatementAboutList4: navigate most of the service using speech recognition software
accessibilityStatementAboutList5: listen to most of the service using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)
accessibilityStatementAboutEnd: We’ve also made the service text as simple as possible to understand.
accessibilityStatementFindOutMore: Find out more about accessibility support for Companies House users.
accessibilityStatementAbilityNet: AbilityNet has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.
accessibilityStatementHowAccessibileText: We know some parts of this service are not fully accessible:
accessibilityStatementHowAccessibileReas: there is not enough colour contrast between text and its background on a small number of pages
accessibilityStatementReportingPreLink: We’re always looking to improve the accessibility of this service. If you find any problems not listed on this page or think we’re not meeting accessibility requirements, you can find contact details on our
accessibilityStatementReportingLinkText: accessibility support for Companies House users
accessibilityStatementEnforcementPreLink: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the ‘accessibility regulations’). If you’re not happy with how we respond to your complaint,
accessibilityStatementEnforcementLinkTex: contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS)
accessibilityStatementTechnicalInformati: Companies House is committed to making its website accessible in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
accessibilityStatementComplianceStatusPr: This website is partially compliant with the
accessibilityStatementComplianceStatusPo: AA standard, due to the non-compliances listed below.
accessibilityStatementNonAccessibleConte: The content listed below is non-accessible for the following reasons.
There is not enough colour contrast between text and its background on a small number of pages. This fails WCAG 2.1 success criterion
We plan to fix this issue by 31st January 2024.
accessibilityStatementImproveAccessibili: To improve this service's accessibility, we:
work with real users who have accessibility issues to make sure that our services meet their needs
carry out internal tests for compliance with Web Content Accessibility Guidelines V2.1 level A and level AA
work with external agencies in major UK cities to perform usability research with users
and agencies to take part in usability sessions
build and test our services to meet
accessibilityStatementBlogTextPostLink: to find out more about our user research work.
accessibilityStatementPreperation1: This statement was prepared on 13 July 2023. It was last reviewed on 14 July 2023.
accessibilityStatementPreperation2: This service was last tested on 10 July 2023. The test was carried out internally.
accessibilityStatementPreperation3: We tested the entire end to end journey.
